sen.j: 丹波町（たんばちょう）は、京都府の中部、兵庫県との県境にあった町。
sen.e: Tanba-cho was a town that existed on the border between the central part of Kyoto Prefecture and Hyogo Prefecture.
Tanba-cho was a town that existed on the border between the central part of Kyoto Prefecture and Hyogo Prefecture.
Tanba-cho was a town that existed on the border between the central part of Kyoto Prefecture and Hyogo Prefecture.

sen.j: 丹波高地にある山と緑に囲まれた静かな町。
sen.e: It is a quiet town surrounded by mountains and greenery in the Tanba Highlands.
It was a quiet town surrounded by mountains and greenery in the Tanba Highlands.
It was a quiet town surrounded by mountains and greenery in the Tanba Highlands.

sen.j: 古くは山陰街道の宿場町として栄えた。
sen.e: The town once flourished as a post station on the Sanin Kaido Road.
The town once flourished as a post station on the Sanin Kaido Road.
The town once flourished as a post station on the Sanin Kaido Road.

sen.j: 2005年10月11日周辺2町と合併し京丹波町となった。
sen.e: On October 11, 2005, Tanba-cho and the two nearby towns were combined to form Kyotanba-cho.
On October 11, 2005, Tanba-cho and the two nearby towns were combined to form Kyotanba-cho.
On October 11, 2005, Tanba-cho and the two nearby towns were combined to form Kyotanba-cho.

sen.j: 由良川水系の支流である高屋（たかや）川・須知（しゅうち）川などが流れており、田園風景が広がる。
sen.e: The Takaya-gawa River and the Shuchi-gawa River, tributaries of the Yura-gawa River system, run through the town with countryside views.
The Takaya-gawa River and the Shuchi-gawa River, tributaries of the Yura-gawa River system, run through the town with countryside views.
The Takaya-gawa River and the Shuchi-gawa River, tributaries of the Yura-gawa River system, run through the town with countryside views.

sen.j: 丹波町付近が由良川水系と淀川水系の分水界となっている。
sen.e: The area around Tanba-cho is the watershed of the Yura-gawa River system and the Yodo-gawa River system.
The area around Tanba-cho is the watershed of the Yura-gawa River system and the Yodo-gawa River system.
The area around Tanba-cho is the watershed of the Yura-gawa River system and the Yodo-gawa River system.

sen.j: 竹野（たけの）地域は南部に位置し、観音峠（国道9号）などにより園部町と道路でつながっている。
sen.e: The Takeno area is located in the south, and is connected to Sonobe-cho via Kannon-toge Mountain Pass (the National Highway 9),
The Takeno area is located in the south, and is connected to Sonobe-cho via Kannon-toge Mountain Pass (the National Highway 9),
The Takeno area is located in the south, and is connected to Sonobe-cho via Kannon-toge Mountain Pass (the National Route 9).
sen.cmt: 国道→national route としました。

sen.j: 須知（しゅうち）地域は中部の南に位置し、町役場や「丹波マーケス」などの中心施設が建ち並んでいる。
sen.e: The Shuchi area is located in the south of the central part, boasting core facilities such as the municipal office and Tanba Markesu.
The Shuchi area is located in the south of the central part, boasting core facilities such as the municipal office and Tanba Markesu.
The Shuchi area is located in the south of the central part, boasting core facilities such as the municipal office and Tanba Markesu.

sen.j: 高原（たかはら）地域は中部の北に位置し、特に農作物の栽培が盛んである。
sen.e: The Takahara area is located in the north of the central part, and crops in particular are widely grown in the area.
The Takahara area is located in the north of the central part, and crops in particular are widely grown in the area.
The Takahara area is located in the north of the central part, and crops in particular are widely grown in the area.

sen.j: 下山（しもやま）地域は北部に位置し、高屋川の河岸段丘を形成している。
sen.e: The Shimoyama area is located in the north, and forms a part of fluvial terrace of the Takaya-gawa River.
The Shimoyama area is located in the north, and forms a part of fluvial terrace of the Takaya-gawa River.
The Shimoyama area is located in the north, and forms a part of fluvial terrace of the Takaya-gawa River.

sen.j: 須知商店街付近には、山陰街道の宿場町として栄えた面影が残っている。
sen.e: The area around the Shuchi shopping street shows signs of the once flourishing post station on the Sanin Kaido Road.
The area around the Shuchi shopping street shows signs of the once flourishing post station on the Sanin Kaido Road.
The area around the Shuchi shopping street shows signs of the once flourishing post station on the Sanin Kaido Road.

sen.j: 国道9号沿いの「丹波マーケス」は大型の複合商業施設であり、スーパーマーケットなどが出店しており、多くの買い物客でにぎわう。
sen.e: Tanba Markesu is a large commercial complex in which stores such as grocery stores open, full of shoppers.
Tanba Markesu is a large commercial complex containing grocery and other stores, which see are filled with shoppers.
Tanba Markesu located along the National Route 9 is a large commercial complex containing grocery and other stores, which are filled with shoppers.
sen.cmt: 国道→national route としました。文法を修正しました。

sen.j: 4月1日、須知町と高原村が合併、丹波町が誕生。
sen.e: On April 1, Shuchi-cho and Takahara-mura were combined to form Tanba-cho.
On April 1, Shuchi-cho and Takahara-mura were combined to form Tanba-cho.
April 1: Shuchi-cho and Takahara-mura were combined to form Tanba-cho.

sen.j: 2月27日、町内の農場でトリインフルエンザの感染の疑い例が発生。
sen.e: On February 27, a suspected case of avian influenza was reported in a farm in the town.
On February 27, a farm in the town reported a suspected case of avian influenza.
February 27: A suspected case of avian influenza was reported in a farm in the town.
sen.cmt: "On February 27, a"→"February 27: A"に変更しました。

sen.j: これを受けて同日、高病原性鳥インフルエンザ丹波町対策本部を設置。
sen.e: To deal with the emergency, a Tanba-cho task force on highly pathogenic avian influenza was established on the same day.
A Tanba-cho task force on highly pathogenic avian influenza was established on the same day to deal with the emergency,
A Tanba-cho task force on highly pathogenic avian influenza was established on the same day to deal with the emergency,

sen.j: 2月29日トリインフルエンザの陽性反応を確認。
sen.e: On February 29, the farm tested positive for avian influenza.
On February 29, the farm tested positive for avian influenza.
February 29: The farm tested positive for avian influenza.
sen.cmt: "On February 29, the"→"February 29: The"に変更しました。

sen.j: 3月5日、別の農場で新たな感染を確認。
sen.e: On March 5, another farm tested positive.
On March 5, another farm tested positive.
March 5: Another farm tested positive.
sen.cmt: "On March 5, another"→"March 5: Another"に変更しました。

sen.j: 3月22日、全ての防疫措置が完了。
sen.e: By March 22, all biosecurity measures had been implemented.
By March 22, all biosecurity measures had been implemented.
March 22: All biosecurity measures had been implemented.
sen.cmt: "By March 22, all"→"March 22: All"に変更しました。

sen.j: 2004年4月1日、「丹波町・瑞穂町 (京都府)・和知町合併協議会」設立。
sen.e: On March 1, 2004, Council on municipal merger of Tanba-cho, Mizuho-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), and Wachi-cho was established.
On March 1, 2004, a council on municipal merger of Tanba-cho, Mizuho-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), and Wachi-cho was established.
April 1, 2004: A council on municipal merger of Tanba-cho, Mizuho-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), and Wachi-cho was established.
sen.cmt: 4月に修正しました。"On April 1, 2004, a"→"April 1, 2004: A"に変更しました。

sen.j: 2005年10月11日、上記３町が合併し、京丹波町町制施行。
sen.e: On October 11, 2005, these three towns were combined to implement the chosei of Kyotanba-cho (grant of township).
On October 11, 2005, these three towns were combined to implement the chosei of Kyotanba-cho (grant of township).
October 11, 2005: These three towns were combined to implement the chosei of Kyotanba-cho (grant of township).
sen.cmt: "On October 11, 2005, these"→"October 11, 2005: These"に変更しました。

sen.j: 横山 義雄（1994年から）
sen.e: Yoshio YOKOYAMA (since 1994)
Yoshio YOKOYAMA (since 1994)
Yoshio YOKOYAMA (since 1994)

sen.j: 主な産業は、農業（稲作、酪農が中心）と林業。
sen.e: Agriculture (centered on rice cultivation and dairy farming) and forestry are the main industries.
Agriculture (centered on rice cultivation and dairy farming) and forestry are the town's main industries.
Agriculture (centered on rice cultivation and dairy farming) and forestry are the town's main industries.

sen.j: 特産物は、丹波黒豆、丹波マツタケ、丹波栗などが有名。
sen.e: Specialty crops such as Tanba black bean, Tanba matsutake mushroom, Tanba chestnut are famous.
Specialty crops such as Tanba black bean, Tanba matsutake mushroom, and Tanba chestnut are famous.
Specialty crops such as Tanba black bean, Tanba matsutake mushroom, and Tanba chestnut are famous.

sen.j: 上士幌町（北海道）友好町
sen.e: Kamishihoro-cho in Hokkaido (friendship town)
Kamishihoro-cho in Hokkaido (friendship town)
Kamishihoro-cho in Hokkaido (friendship town)

sen.j: 1976年1月1日友好都市提携
sen.e: On January 1, 1976, a friendship town agreement was signed.
On January 1, 1976, a friendship town agreement was signed.
On January 1, 1976, a friendship town agreement was signed.

sen.j: 観光地は、丹波自然運動公園、琴滝（ことだき）、ワインハウスなどがある。
sen.e: Major tourist spots are the Tanba Shizen Undo Koen Park, Koto-daki (Koto Falls), and the Wine House.
